Package imagingbook.lib.filters

Class GenericFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.lib.filters.GenericFilter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BilateralFilter, KuwaharaFilter, LinearFilter, NagaoMatsuyamaFilter, ScalarMedianFilter, VectorMedianFilter, VectorMedianFilterSharpen
    public abstract class GenericFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class represents a generic filter that, when applied to an ImageProcessor object performs all pixel-level iterations automatically. Concrete implementations of this class need to define only two methods:
    float filterPixel(ImageAccessor.Scalar, int, int) and
    float[] filterPixel(ImageAccessor.Rgb, int, int).
    See LinearFilter for a sample implementation.
    Note that this is experimental code!
    Version:
    2016/11/01

      • filterPixel

        public abstract float filterPixel​(ImageAccessor.Scalar source,
                                  int u,
                                  int v)
        Calculates and returns the filter result for a single pixel at the given position.
        Parameters:
        source - the ImageAccessor.Scalar representing the source (scalar-valued) image
        u - the horizontal pixel position
        v - the vertical pixel position
        Returns:
        the resulting (scalar) filter value for the specified pixel position

      • filterPixel

        public abstract float[] filterPixel​(ImageAccessor.Rgb source,
                                    int u,
                                    int v)
        Calculates and returns the filter result for a single pixel at the given position.
        Parameters:
        source - the ImageAccessor.Rgb representing the source (RGB) image
        u - the horizontal pixel position
        v - the vertical pixel position
        Returns:
        the resulting (RGB) filter value for the specified pixel position

      • applyTo

        public void applyTo​(ij.process.ImageProcessor ip)
        Dispatch work depending on actual (runtime) type of processor. This is ugly but we want to avoid generic types (which would not be of much help in this case anyway).
        Parameters:
        ip - the image this filter is applied to (destructively)
